verses.text: And now, O ye priests , this commandment \add is\add* for you.

If ye will not hear , and if ye will not lay \add it\add* to heart , to give glory unto my name , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , I will even send a curse upon you, and I will curse your blessings : yea, I have cursed them already, because ye do not lay \add it\add* to heart.

Behold, I will corrupt your seed , and spread dung upon your faces , \add even\add* the dung of your solemn feasts ; and \add one\add* shall take you away with it.\f + \fr 2.3 \ft corrupt: or, reprove\f*\f + \fr 2.3 \ft spread: Heb. scatter\f*\f + \fr 2.3 \ft one…: or, it shall take you away to it\f*
And ye shall know that I have sent this commandment unto you, that my covenant might be with Levi , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts.
My covenant was with him of life and peace ; and I gave them to him \add for\add* the fear wherewith he feared me, and was afraid before my name.
The law of truth was in his mouth , and iniquity was not found in his lips : he walked with me in peace and equity , and did turn many away from iniquity.
For the priest’s lips should keep knowledge , and they should seek the law at his mouth : for he \add is\add* the messenger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts.

But ye are departed out of the way ; ye have caused many to stumble at the law ; ye have corrupted the covenant of Levi , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts.\f + \fr 2.8 \ft stumble at: or, fall in\f*

Therefore have I also made you contemptible and base before all the people , according as ye have not kept my ways , but have been partial in the law.\f + \fr 2.9 \ft have been…: or, lifted up the face against: Heb. accepted faces\f* \p
Have we not all one father ? hath not one God created us? why do we deal treacherously every man against his brother , by profaning the covenant of our fathers ? \p

¶ Judah hath dealt treacherously , and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem ; for Judah hath profaned the holiness of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* which he loved , and hath married the daughter of a strange god.\f + \fr 2.11 \ft loved: or, ought to love\f*

The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* will cut off the man that doeth this, the master and the scholar , out of the tabernacles of Jacob , and him that offereth an offering unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts.  +  r 2.12  t the master…: or, him that waketh, and him that answereth *

And this have ye done again , covering the altar of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* with tears , with weeping , and with crying out , insomuch that he regardeth not the offering any more, or receiveth \add it\add* with good will at your hand. \p

¶ Yet ye say , Wherefore ? Because the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath been witness between thee and the wife of thy youth , against whom thou hast dealt treacherously : yet \add is\add* she thy companion , and the wife of thy covenant.

And did not he make one ? Yet had he the residue of the spirit. And wherefore one ? That he might seek a godly seed. Therefore take heed to your spirit , and let none deal treacherously against the wife of his youth.\f + \fr 2.15 \ft residue: or, excellency\f*\f + \fr 2.15 \ft godly…: Heb. seed of God\f*\f + \fr 2.15 \ft treacherously: or, unfaithfully\f*

For the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, the God of Israel , saith that he hateth putting away : for \add one\add* covereth violence with his garment , saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts : therefore take heed to your spirit , that ye deal not treacherously.  +  r 2.16  t that he…: or, if he hate her, put her away *  +  r 2.16  t putting…: Heb. to put away * \p

¶ Ye have wearied the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* with your words. Yet ye say , Wherein have we wearied \add him?\add* When ye say , Every one that doeth evil \add is\add* good in the sight of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and he delighteth in them; or, Where \add is\add* the God of judgment ?
